conclusion: Need to analyze acceleration graph and forces acting on elevator to determine state at t=4.5s
Graph shows acceleration vs time; acceleration increases from 0 to 2 m/s^2 from t=0 to t=1s
Acceleration is constant at 2 m/s^2 from t=1s to t=4s
Acceleration decreases linearly from 2 m/s^2 to 0 m/s^2 from t=4s to t=5s
At t=4.5s, acceleration is decreasing from 2 m/s^2 to 0 m/s^2
At t=4.5s, acceleration is 1 m/s^2, halfway between 2 m/s^2 and 0 m/s^2
Weightlessness occurs when net acceleration equals gravitational acceleration in opposite direction
Overload occurs when net acceleration is greater than gravitational acceleration
Net force is sum of gravitational force and force due to elevator's acceleration
At t=4.5s, elevator's acceleration is 1 m/s^2 upward
Net acceleration less than g, so elevator is not in overload
Elevator is not in weightlessness as net acceleration is not zero
At t=4.5s, elevator is neither in weightlessness nor overload; net acceleration is 8.8 m/s^2
